ETYMOLOGY: From Old English cyning, cyng ('king'), from Proto-Germanic *kuningaz (from *kunjan 'kin, race' + suffix *-ingaz 'belonging to'). Related to 'kin'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The male ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个独立国家的男性统治者，特别是通过世袭获得该职位的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The young prince will one day become king.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位年轻的王子终有一天会成为国王。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The most important piece in chess, which the opponent tries to checkmate.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 国际象棋中最重要的一枚棋子，对手的目标是将其将死。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The player moved his king to safety to avoid checkmate.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 棋手将他的国王移到了安全位置以避免被将死。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person or thing that is considered the best or most important of its kind.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 被认为是其种类中最好或最重要的人或物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Elvis Presley is widely known as the King of Rock and Roll.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 埃尔维斯·普雷斯利被广泛称为摇滚乐之王。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A playing card bearing the figure of a king, normally ranking next below the ace.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一张印有国王图案的扑克牌，通常排名仅次于A。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He drew a king of spades and won the hand.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他抽到了一张黑桃K，赢得了这手牌。
